title: Monte Ferro 2014 Dion Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Pale rose in color, this soft, tasty wine seems to be moving quickly along the aging curve. It spent some time in 30% new French oak, cloaking its flavors of rhubarb pie in highlights of cracker and milk chocolate. Drink this sooner rather than later.

title: Ronco Blanchis 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Muted scents of orchard fruit and a touch of almond lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers pear, citrus zest and mineral accompanied by bracing acidity.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Colheita Tinto Red (Beira Interior)
description: A blend of Tinta Roriz and the local Jaen, this wine has both fresh fruits and dry tannins. The fruits are going to prevail, giving red berry fruit flavors with fresh, cool acidity. The tannins will be there to sustain the fruit. Drink from late 2016.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Reserva Branco White (Douro)
description: The rare Codega do Larinho grapes make up half this rich, perfumed wine. Touched by the wood aging, it is both fruity and has more complex toast and almond flavors. It's ripe but could do with a few more months. Drink from the end of 2016.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Espirto do Côa Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Espirito do Côa is named after the prehistoric wall drawings that decorate the cliffs of the valley. The wine is rich, dense and fruity. Blackberries and fine acidity give a tarry, dense character. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Naia 2014 Las Brisas White (Rueda)
description: Citrusy aromas of lemon and grapefruit show a leesy side note. This blend of 50% Verdejo, 30% Viura and 20% Sauvignon Blanc is pithy and citric on the palate, with flavors of lemon, green apple and orange peel that carry onto a lasting, healthy finish.

title: Pagos del Rey 2014 Arnegui  (Rioja)
description: Fresh, dry red-fruit aromas lead the charge on this tasty but simple Rioja that feels crisp, healthy and balanced. Flavors of plum, raspberry and herbs finish mild.

title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2014 Reserva Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Pungent, yeasty, almost sweaty notes of onion and garlic blend with oak-infused cider and citrus aromas. This is round, fresh and not too heavy on the palate, while its oaky, smoky barrel and baked-apple flavors end with overt woodiness and mounting bitterness.

title: Santa Ynez Valley Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petite Sirah, 8% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot shows grape-candy aromas along with uncrushed peppercorns and blackberry jam. The palate offers fresh olallieberries with chocolate, pencil lead and a touch of dried mint.

title: Luis Duarte 2014 Rapariga da Quinta Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This is a warm ripe wine that has richness as well as a more mineral texture. Yellow peach and white pear flavors are sustained by the tight, young acidity that gives considerable freshness. The wine needs a few more months before it is totally balanced. Drink from the mid 2016.

title: Petrucco 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of wildflower, orchard fruit and hazelnut open on the nose. The lively, linear palate shows crunchy green pear, bitter almond and a hint of nutmeg alongside racy acidity.

title: Petrucco 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Green apple and citrus aromas float out of the glass while the bright, straightforward palate offers Bartlett pear and juicy nectarine zest. Tangy acidity leaves a crisp finish.

title: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)
description: Pure varietal, this pushes the winery's characteristic oaky, smoky winemaking style to the limits. There's some bright, tart raspberry fruit in the mix, but the scents and flavors of charred wood dominate from first sniff to last swallow.

title: Fullerton 2013 Croft Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This vineyard-designate saw 40% new French oak, putting some pastry and baking-spice flavors around the cherry fruit. There's a suggestion of the tack room, and a finish that turns a bit dilute, with a Dr Pepper zing to it.

title: Gigante 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Tomato vine, elderflower, hay, chopped herb and passion fruit aromas take center stage. The palate isn't as exuberant as the nose, offering grapefruit, sage and mineral before the salty finish.

title: Eola Hills 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Oregon)
description: This pure varietal is fresh and creamy, with bracing minerality. Fruit flavors suggest fresh-cut apples with a twist of lemon.

title: Kenwood 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: One would be hard-pressed to find a better deal in large-production, Sonoma County Cabernet. This wine offers dark opaque color and suede-like layers of chocolate and blackberry jam. The tannins are velvety and accented in high-toned plum, with a soft, leathery finish.

title: La Tunella 2014 Col Matiss Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Hay, chopped herb, exotic fruit and a light whiff of oak come together on this wine. The firm palate shows grapefruit, unripe yellow stone fruit and mineral accompanied by racy acidity.

title: La Tunella 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Vibrant and linear, this offers scents of orchard fruit and citrus. The crisp, straightforward palate tastes of juicy grapefruit, white peach and a mineral note alongside lively acidity.

title: Lacheteau NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: Produced in Vouvray, this perfumed, lightly honeyed wine is creamy and soft to drink. There is some fine acidity to give a light touch to the ripe fruitiness. There is a nutty quality that's typical of the Chenin Blanc in the blend. The aftertaste suggests the wine could age a few months in bottle.

title: Livio Felluga 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Subtle herbaceous aromas of cut grass and tomato vine lead the nose. The somewhat lean, straightforward palate shows white grapefruit, a hint of tangerine, mineral and a note of green pepper.

title: Domaine Zinck 2014 Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Earthy notes dominate the nose and hide the lemon and pear notes that are more apparent on the fresh, light and dry palate. This is easy and mild, drink soon.

title: Karl Kaspar 2014 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Lemon and white grapefruit flavors shine brightly in this off-dry Riesling quaffer. It's fresh and fruity but balanced vibrantly by zesty lime acidity. Drink now.

title: Meran 2014 Festival Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of white spring blossom and orchard fruit. The bright, straightforward palate offers Kaiser pear, juicy yellow peach and a lemon zest note alongside vibrant acidity.

title: Meran 2014 Festival Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Aromas of green apple and white peach lead the nose and follow through to the zesty palate along with notes of pear and candied lemon peel. Lively acidity gives it a crisp finish.

title: 2 Lads 2013 Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: An earthy geranium note lingers above a core of dark cherry and raspberry on the nose. The medium-bodied palate boasts light tannins and a flavor profile of cherries, wilting red flowers and anise.

title: Adega Mãe 2014 White (Lisboa)
description: Found more often (although still rarely) in the Douro, the Viosinho is distinguished by its high acidity. In the coastal climate of Lisboa, that steely character is still there. It should calm down a little over the next few months and fill out with the apple fruit flavors that are just hints at present. Drink from late 2016.

title: Alessio Komjanc 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: Yellow wildflower, white stone fruit and crushed rock aromas lead the nose while the lively palate offers mineral, almond and yellow apple. It's vibrant, with bright acidity.

title: Alois Lageder 2014 Lehen Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: The nose isn't overly expressive but eventually reveals suggestions of tropical fruit, chopped herb and a whiff of stone. The straightforward, slender palate offers grapefruit, a hint of peach and mineral accompanied by crisp acidity.

title: Alois Lageder 2014 Müller-Thurgau (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)
description: Light and vibrant, this opens with aromas of fragrant spring flower, stone fruit and a suggestion of nutmeg. The palate offers white peach, apple and a hint of almond alongside crisp acidity.
